meanings.definition: A dry dehiscent fruit that splits into two or more parts when mature.
meanings.sent1: The siliquae of the plant burst open to release their seeds.
meanings.sent2: The farmer collected the siliquae from the mustard plants.
meanings.sent3: The siliquae decided to have a race to see who could split open first.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the siliquae, splitting the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The siliquae danced in the wind, scattering seeds far and wide.

meanings.definition: A seed vessel of a plant in the mustard family, typically long and narrow.
meanings.sent1: She carefully examined the siliquae to identify the plant species.
meanings.sent2: The siliquae of the mustard plant contained tiny seeds.
meanings.sent3: The siliquae rolled down the hill, pretending to be a tiny boat.
meanings.sent4: His words were like siliquae, carrying the promise of new beginnings.
meanings.sent5: The siliquae shimmered in the sunlight, a delicate vessel for life.
